item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "In love one should exercise economy of intercourse. None of us can love for ever. Love will be stronger and will last longer if there are impediments of its gratification. If a lover is prevented from enjoying his love by absence, difficulty of access, or by the caprice or coldness of his beloved, he can find a little consolation in the thought that when his wishes are fulfilled his delight will be intense. But love being what it is, should there be no hindrances, he will pay no attention to the considerations of prudence; and his punishment will be satiety. The love that lasts longest is the love that is never returned." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description:
"There was no meaning in life, and man by living served no end. It was immaterial whether he was born or not born, whether he lived or ceased to live. Life was insignificant and death without consequence. Philip exulted, as he had exulted in his boyhood when the weight of a belief in God was lifted from his shoulders: it seemed to him that the last burden of responsibility was taken from him; and for the first time he was utterly free. His insignificance was turned to power, and he felt himself suddenly equal with the cruel fate which had seemed to persecute him; for, if life was meaningless, the world was robbed of its cruelty. What he did or left undone did not matter. Failure was unimportant and success amounted to nothing. He was the most inconsiderate creature in that swarming mass of mankind which for a brief space occupied the surface of the earth; and he was almighty because he had wrenched from chaos the secret of its nothingness. Thoughts came tumbling over one another in Philip's eager fancy, and he took long breaths of joyous satisfaction. He felt inclined to leap and sing. He had not been so happy for months.
'Oh, life,' he cried in his heart, 'Oh life, where is thy sting?" -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One should absorb the colour of life, but one should never remember its details. Details are always vulgar." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Familiarity breeds contempt and children." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Distance lends enchantment to the view." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good breeding consists of concealing how much we think of ourselves and how little we think of the other person." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The passing moment is all we can be sure of; it is only common sense to extract its utmost value from it." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The important thing was to love rather than to be loved." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It is hard that a man's exterior should tally so little sometimes with his soul." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Though I said that affection was the greatest enemy of love, I would never deny that it's a very good substitute. I'm not sure that a marriage founded on it isn't the happiest. [The book-bag]" -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "What makes old age hard to bear is not the failing of one's faculties, mental and physical, but the burden of one's memories." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "He did not care if she was heartless, vicious and vulgar, stupid and grasping, he loved her. He would rather have misery with one than happiness with the other." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "As lovers, the difference between men and women is that women can love all day long, but men only at times." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Oh, it's always the same,' she sighed, 'if you want men to behave well to you, you must be beastly to them; if you treat them decently they make you suffer for it." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There's always one who loves and one who lets himself be loved." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W.Somerset Maugham
item.description: "When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character." -- W.Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it; but the young know they are wretched for they are full of the truthless ideal which have been instilled into them, and each time they come in contact with the real, they are bruised and wounded. It looks as if they were victims of a conspiracy; for the books they read, ideal by the necessity of selection, and the conversation of their elders, who look back upon the past through a rosy haze of forgetfulness, prepare them for an unreal life. They must discover for themselves that all they have read and all they have been told are lies, lies, lies; and each discovery is another nail driven into the body on the cross of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It was one of the queer things of life that you saw a person every day for months and were so intimate with him that you could not imagine existence without him; then separation came, and everything went on in the same way, and the companion who had seemed essential proved unnecessary." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The love that lasts the longest is the love that is never returned" -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There is no cruelty greater than a woman's to a man who loves her and whom she does not love; she has no kindness then, no tolerance even, she has only an insane irritation." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Unfortunately sometimes one can't do what one thinks is right without making someone else unhappy." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "In the first place it's not true that people improve as you know them better: they don't. That's why one should only have acquaintances and never make friends. An acquaintance shows you only the best of himself, he's considerate and polite, he conceals his defects behind a mask of social convention; but we grow so intimate with him that he throws the mask aside, get to know him so well that he doesn't trouble any longer to pretend; then you'll discover a being of such meanness, of such trivial nature, of such weakness, of such corruption, that you'd be aghast if you didn't realize that that was his nature and it was just as stupid to condemn him as to condemn the wolf because he ravens or the cobra because he strikes." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "We are not the same persons this year as last; nor are those we love. It is a happy chance if we, changing, continue to love a changed person." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It’s a very funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "How can I be reasonable? To me our love was everything and you were my whole life. It is not very pleasant to realize that to you it was only an episode." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sandhya add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "When a woman loves you she's not satisfied until she possesses your soul. Because she's weak, she has a rage for domination, and nothing less will satisfy her." -- W. Somerset Maugham
